title: About
text: The Finance, technology and Artificial intelligence research laB (hereafter F.A.B.) is a cross-disciplinary research project within the finance group of Queen’s Management School. The lab will be industry-focused and aims to provide thought leadership for Northern Ireland’s vibrant financial technology ecosystem.1

title: Finance, technology and Artificial intelligence research laB
text:
Activities

Portal for academics in QMS and beyond to co-produce research with industry partners in finance.
Flagship projects:

Rethinking econometrics for the age of AI implementation.

In collaboration with EEECS, with places funded by BRCD monies, FAB will launch a postgraduate courses in financial technology and machine learning, designed specifically to up-skill and re-skill talent to help scale Northern Ireland FinTech capabilities.

Financial tail risk, advanced analytics and artificial intelligence (co-produced research with NI FinTechs).
Financial technologies and financial inclusion (Fully funded AHSS International PhD Scholar).
Trader surveillance, econometric identification and market microstructure (CSIT + FAB collaborations)

Funding opportunities with CSIT from the new Global Innovations Institutes route.
Actively engage in corporate sponsorship and collaboration funding projects.

Possibilities for sponsorship for access to expertise, workshops, and lab-affiliated graduates.

Industry-sponsored research activities, including PhD co-funding like CAST.
Establishing a sandbox program to cultivate future-ready graduates by transforming our courses into real-world sandboxes, bringing together students, academics, and industry to co-create solutions for contemporary problems5.

title: Rationale
text:
The financial services industry has witnessed a rapid expansion in the use digital innovation with early estimates suggesting an upper bound in annual value potential of one trillion dollars (or 13.4% of sales) globally1. As a highly regulated system, the key drives of further technological adoption are:

operational resilience regulations;
Cloud migration for business agility, economic sustainability , and net-zero environmental benefits;
Cyber security, risk and privacy;
AI and machine learning adoption.

The trends in digital finance were facilitated by the growth of hybrid cloud and advances in digital automation. All four drivers have strong links to research areas of AI-safety (in computer science) and risk management (in finance), and financial regulators across the world are grappling with “rules on the books” to provide robust guide rails for this viral-like growth of the digital economy.

Why F.A.B. at Queen’s University Belfast?

Northern Ireland is recognised as a world-leading cyber security ecosystem underpinned by QUB’s CSIT (Centre for Secure Intelligent Technology) – the UK’s largest cybersecurity-focused university technology partner.
The ability to write bespoke training programmes and provide skills required (albeit lead time is required).
Existing core tech capability to be enhanced via Belfast Region City Deals and the overall 10X economic strategy in NI.
The unique location gives access to UK and EU markets.

Queen’s Management School are uniquely positioned to establish an emerging research lab for financial technology, working in partnership with CSIT, to provide business and financial insights for the digital economy.

title: About
text:
Mission
The mission is to bridge gaps between information technologies, data science, innovation, and financial decision-making. Our goal is to be a global lab of excellence, uniquely located at the gateway between the UK, and the EU. To achieve this mission the lab has the following strategic goals:

Produce internationally acclaimed research in finance, technology, AI and data science.
Strengthen and develop linkages with School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science.2
Foster national and international partnerships with other research labs in financial technology, AI and data science.
Nuclei local fintech companies to inform disruptive research in technology adoption in finance.
